paper.title: A dynamic look-ahead Monte Carlo algorithm for pricing Bermudan options
paper.abstract: Under the assumption of no-arbitrage, the pricing of American and Bermudan options can be casted into optimal stopping problems. We propose a new adaptive simulation based algorithm for the numerical solution of optimal stopping problems in discrete time. Our approach is to recursively compute the so-called continuation values. They are defined as regression functions of the cash flow, which would occur over a series of subsequent time periods, if the approximated optimal exercise strategy is applied. We use nonparametric least squares regression estimates to approximate the continuation values from a set of sample paths which we simulate from the underlying stochastic process. The parameters of the regression estimates and the regression problems are chosen in a data-dependent manner. We present results concerning the consistency and rate of convergence of the new algorithm. Finally, we illustrate its performance by pricing high-dimensional Bermudan basket options with strangle-spread payoff based on the average. of the underlying assets.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是提出一种动态前瞻蒙特卡洛算法，专门用于定价百慕大期权（Bermudan options），这直接属于衍生品定价领域。论文还讨论了高维百慕大篮子期权的定价，进一步证实了其在衍生品定价中的应用。
